nodes.description: 曼彻斯特炸弹袭击者在学校时属于一个阿拉伯语‘小团体’，该团体指责一位老师对自杀炸弹犯的批评存在伊斯兰恐惧症。
nodes.support_text: The Manchester bomber was in an Arabic-speaking “clique” at school which accused a teacher of Islamophobia for criticising a suicide bomber in class, The Times has learnt.

nodes.description: 在2009年至2011年就读于Burnage Academy for Boys期间，阿比迪被认为是一个易怒的年轻人，与同学不太合群。
nodes.support_text: Salman Abedi, 22, who grew up on council estates in south Manchester, was viewed in his school days as an angry young man who did not quite fit in.

nodes.description: 一群男孩对一位老师提出的问题表示不满，该老师询问他们如何看待一个会绑炸弹炸死人的家伙。
nodes.support_text: During his time at Burnage Academy for Boys between 2009 and 2011, Abedi is believed to have been among a group of boys who took issue with a teacher who had “asked what they thought of someone who would strap on a bomb and blow people up,” a source said.

nodes.description: 这群男孩向宗教教育老师投诉，称老师的提问存在伊斯兰恐惧症。
nodes.support_text: “A group went to complain to their RE teacher saying it was Islamophobic.”

nodes.description: 阿贝迪被认为是个傻男孩。

edges.support_text: The Manchester bomber was in an Arabic-speaking “clique” at school which accused a teacher of Islamophobia for criticising a suicide bomber in class, The Times has learnt.
Salman Abedi, 22, who grew up on council estates in south Manchester, was viewed in his school days as an angry young man who did not quite fit in.

During his time at Burnage Academy for Boys between 2009 and 2011, Abedi is believed to have been among a group of boys who took issue with a teacher who had “asked what they thought of someone who would strap on a bomb and blow people up,” a source said.
